class.name: Moon Guardian

default: (a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}, (b) a {@item diplomat's pack|PHB}

classFeatures: The Call of the Moon|Moon Guardian|SRPMoonGuardian|11

entries: A pale human stands in the moonlight, greatsword gleaming as the red moon wanes in the background, shining its light on a swarm of felled foes.
As your final moment draw near, you see in the darkness a dim beacon of hope. Your Tiefling companion knelt in reverence to the moon, bathes you and your party in protective energy.
When the battle seems all but lost, a quiet prayer is heard as an image of the moon blocks out the sun and your Triton ally glows with a celestial light as she charges the enemy alone.

entries.name: Moon Guardian
entries: The Moon is a powerful entity. A celestial body that affects the entirety of Kagrea from it's place in the heavens. The Moon tugs at our waters creating tides, guides those who cannot see through the darkness, and to a select few, it grants them extraordinary strength and wisdom. Each Moon Guardian is blessed by the moon, marking them. These markings can range from a small birthmark on the back of ones neck, to intricate skin patterns that run along the body. Many Moon Guardians walk the path of neutrality, often looking for signs and omens from the moon, instead of walking their own paths. Still, often times Moon Guardians are unpredictable in nature, changing just as often as the wanes and waxes of the moon.

entries.name: Birth Rights
entries: Every Moon Guardian is chosen by the moon at birth. These powers granted by the moons mark usually begin to appear in adolescence for a guardian. Religious cults, tribes of people, and sects of Moon Guardians themselves often seek out moons marks on children in hopes to develop and manifest their powers as soon as possible. Many more still are born without knowledge of their blessing. As such they go far into life before discovering the power they have been granted. Moon Guardians are often found in certain bloodlines throughout history. The father or grandmother of Moon Guardians are often Moon Guardians themselves Some peoples consider the birth of a Moon Guardian a blessing for the future. Others say they are harbingers of doom.

entries.name: Moon Weapon
entries: A Moon Guardian and their weapon are very closely tied. These weapons are usually just as important to a Moon Guardian as their mark itself, as the weapon is how they channel most of the moons power. Channeling power through a weapon requires two hands, as the moon asks for complete dedication to it. A Moon guardian is seldom seen without their weapon and they are often symbols of which blessings they have received. Blue Moon The blessing of the blue moon allows you to become more rational and calm in the face of adversity. Your link with nature becomes more assertive, and you feel more connected to every creature that surrounds you. You push and pull the ebb and flow of battle, using the moons energy to bring life to yourself and allies

entries.name: Creating A Moon Guardian
entries: If you wish to create a Moon Guardian, think about your connection to the moon, about your path to serving it. Decide how you have used your abilities to get through life and when your powers first manifested..

fluff.name: Moon Guardian

classFeature.name: Moon Wisdom
entries: When you reach 1st level the Moon whispers wonders and secrets into your being, slowly claiming your dedication and guarding you against unwanted rest. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

classFeature.name: Moon Eyes
entries: At 1st level, your eyes are incredibly keen, and under the moonlight shine with a blue aura that resembles the moon brightness. Your eyes allow you the following two abilities:

entries.name: Darkvision\:
entries: Blessed with the moon powers, your vision can easily cut through the darkness. You can see dim light within 60 feet of you like bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Astronomical Knowledge\:
entries: Whenever you make a check pertaining to the stars or other cosmic bodies, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

classFeature.name: Moon Whispers
entries: At 2nd level, the moon gives its power; you can use your Wisdom modifier for initiative instead of Dexterity.

classFeature.name: The Blessing
entries: At the 3rd level, you choose your blessing through the moon guidance.

items: The blessing you choose grants you features at 3rd and again at 7th, 13th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Moon Weapon
entries: At the 3rd level the moon grants you a bit of her power and a two-handed melee weapon that you choose becomes your Moon Weapon. You can select a new Moon Weapon at the end of a long rest. Your Moon Weapon grants you minor protection while conscious and wielding it you gain +1 AC.

classFeature.name: Moon Charge
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, by channeling the moon's might, a freezing aura envolops your Moon Weapon. Once per short or long ,rest as a bonus action, you may activate this ability onto your Moon Weapon which allows it to deal an additional 1d6 cold damage for ten minutes.
This damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 14th level (2d6).

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you and your Moon Wisdom form a more potent fighting team. When you take the attack action on your turn, if your companion can see you, it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

classFeature.name: Moon Rush
entries: At the 6th level, the Moon Weapon you wield becomes unaffected by gravity. You can now use your Moon Weapon to make a thrown weapon attack to a creature within 15 ft of you.

As a bonus action, if you have thrown your weapon this turn, you can fly to your weapons location in a straight line (or as straight as the terrain allows). Any opportunity attacks made against you while you are flying back are made at disadvantage.
You may use this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier per long rest

entries.name: Throw
entries: You use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

classFeature.name: The Blessing
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blessing Feature

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Guardians Never Die
entries: At the 9th level, if you drop to 0 hit points, a ray of light envelops you and at the start of your next turn you stand up with 1 hit point and are no longer prone. You can use this feature once per long rest.

classFeature.name: The Call of the Moon
entries: At the 11th level, as an action, you may invoke the powers and protection of the moon upon yourself for 10 minutes and gain the following benefits:

items: While wielding your moon weapon you gain an additiomal +1 AC.
All of your attacks with your Moon Weapon deal an extra 2d6 cold damage.
Your weapon deals additional damage equal to your wisdom modifier.

entries: You may use this feature once per short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: The Blessing
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blessing Feature

classFeature.name: Lunar Crash
entries: Beginning at the 14th level your Moon Rush gains reach up to 30 feet.

Additionally any creature within the path between you and your weapon, when you use Moon Rush, must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Wis) on a fail save take 2d8 magical bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Moon Sanctuary
entries: When you reach the 17th level, You pray to the moon to grant you sanctuary. As an action you can cast {@spell Hallow} without spell components and only takes 12 hours to cast.
You can use this feature once per long rest.

classFeature.name: The Blessing feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your The Blessing.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Lunar Acendence
entries: At 20th level once per long rest you can take your ascended form for one minute. If you are in daylight an image of the moon appears to partially eclipse the sun, this eclipse casts everything around you in a 100 foot radius into darkness.

While you are ascended you radiate 15ft of bright silver light. Additionally your Moon Weapon takes on a form twice it's current size, granting it reach of 15ft. Successful Moon Weapon attacks deal their damage in a 5 foot radius of the target as well as to it, as moonlight begins to overflow from their body.

When the creature enters the area of your light for the first time or starts its turn there it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes 3d10 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: The Blessing
entries: All Moon Guardians can call themselves members of the Rider Practice, Elemental Practice, Valiant Practice, Platinum Practice, or Shadow Practice. The Rider Practice focuses on working in sync with their dragon: both in and out of the heat of combat. The bond between knight and dragon is highly valued by those of the Rider Practice. The Elemental Practice heightens their battle skill with magic, believing that the only true way to bond with their dragons is reflect their destructive powers with magic. The Valiant Practice use a banner to support their allies in the heat of battle. The Platinum Practice uses the divine magic of Bahamut to support their allies, protecting them with their divine armour. The Shadow Practice uses misdirection and guile to gain the upper hand in all situations.

subclassFeature.name: Rider Practice
entries: The bond between a Moon Guardian and their dragon is strong, but those of the Rider Practice take that even further beyond. They seek to live and to die beside their dragon, a sentiment shared by the dragon itself. While not all riders mount their dragons, those who don't are rare. Those of the Rider Practice fight in tandem with their dragon, and win in tandem with them.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Claw
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you and your dragon are able to co- ordinate to disorientate your enemies. When both you and your dragon are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, the creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you or your dragon.
Additionally, when a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to attempt to grapple or shove the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Eye
entries: At 3rd level, you and your dragon's keen understanding of each other allows you to better act in battle. You and your dragon can add your Charisma modifier to each of your initiative rolls.
Additionally, if you can see your dragon, creatures that it can see don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being hidden from you.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Scale
entries: Starting at 7th level, if your dragon is within 5 feet of you, it can protect you from a creature it can see as an action. Until the start of the dragon's next turn, the creature's attack rolls against you have disadvantage. If your dragon isn't within 5 feet of you, the effect ends.

Additionally, you can use an action to stabilize your dragon, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check. When stabilized this way, your dragon will regain 1 hit point after 1d4 minutes instead of {@dice 1d4} hours.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Wing
entries: Starting at 10th level, you and your dragon rule the sky. Mounting and dismounting your dragon only costs 5 feet of movement instead of half your speed, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your dragon, and neither you or your dragon take falling damage if you fall 20 feet or less.
Additionally, your dragon can fly up to 20 feet in a straight line upward as an action. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Fang
entries: Starting at 15th level, you and your dragon are able to tear through your enemies. If your dragon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack in the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d10 piercing damage.

Additionally, your dragon can use an action to rampage and make a claw attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of it, with a separate attack roll for each target. If you're within 5 feet of your dragon when they rampage, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against each creature within your reach that was attacked by your dragon during their rampage. Your dragon can't rampage again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Presence
entries: Starting at 18th level, the range of Lunar Crash is increased to 120 feet, creatures that are frightened of your dragon have a speed of 0, and when you or your dragon hit a creature that is frightened of your dragon with a weapon attack, the attack is considered a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Practice
entries: Moon Guardians who practice with the arcane elements are often called 'elementals' for short. They value the raw, destructive power of their dragons, and strive to emulate this through magic. Elementals focus on spells from the evocation and transmutation schools.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you heighten your battle ferocity with the ability to cast spells. See chapter 10 of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 of the Player's Handbook for the sorcerer spell list.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Elemental Practice Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spells level or higher. You regain all expended slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell chromatic orb} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell chromatic orb} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice, one of which you must choose from the evocation and transmutation spells on the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Elemental Spellcasting table shows when you can learn more sorcerer spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an evocation or transmutation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st of 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the sorcerer spells you know with another spell of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an evocation or transmutation spell, unless youâ€™re replacing the spell you gained at 8th, 14th, or 20th level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since your magic draws from the power and dominance of dragons. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Weaponry
entries: At 3rd level, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can imbue your weapon with ancient elemental power. The next time you would hit a creature with a weapon attack before the end of your next turn, that creature takes an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of your dragon's relevant damage type per level of the spell you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Magic
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when you use your action to cast a cantrip, if your Moon Wisdom can see you, it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Fury
entries: At 10th level, whenever you or your dragon rolls damage dice of the appropriate damage type of your dragon, you can treat any 1 you roll as a 2.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Reach
entries: Starting at 15th level, your elemental prowess extends beyond your simple weapon strikes. Whenever you would deal your Elemental Weaponry damage to a creature, you can have up to two creatures within 10 feet of the target of the attack also take half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Magic
entries: At 18th level, when you use your action to cast a spell, if your Moon Wisdom can see you, it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

subclassFeature.name: Platinum Practice
entries: A few Moon Guardians worship the Platinum Dragon, Bahamut. These few are members of the Platinum Practice, and are dedicated to preserving the lives of their allies and the innocent.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Radiance
entries: At 3rd level, your The Call of the Moon and that of your companion shifts to reflect the holy magic you now wield. Your dragon's relevant damage type becomes radiant, and any damage and condition immunities it has are replaced with immunity to radiant damage.
Your dragon also physically shifts to reflect this change, and its scales change colour to look like the brightest platinum.

subclassFeature.name: Platinum Protector
entries: At 3rd level, you can imbue your armour with Bahamut's divine light, allowing you to better protect your allies. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause your armour to glow with divine power; for 1 minute or until you're incapacitated, you shed bright light in a 5 foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Whenever you or another creature takes damage while within 5 feet of you while you shed this light, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by an amount equal to 1d6 + half your Moon Guardian level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all expended uses on a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Light
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you now shed bright light in a 10 foot radius when you cause your armour to shed divine light, and you can now reduce the damage a creature takes while it's within 10 feet of you.

While you channel your divine light, radiant energy circulates through your blood, granting you blessings of fortitude which catalyzes your very presence. While you are using your Platinum Protector feature, you have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws against magical effects, and you cannot be frightened.
When you reach 15th level, both the radius of the light and range you can protect your allies increases to 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Bastion
entries: Beginning at 10th level, you're able to easily stand against the tide of battle. When you or your dragon take the Dodge action on your turn, you can't be moved against your will as long as you're not incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Covenant
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you reduce the damage a creature would take to 0 with your Platinum Protector, you can cause that creature to gain a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Ward
entries: At 18th level, you no longer need to use a reaction to reduce the damage a creature takes with your Platinum Protector feature, and you can reduce the damage a creature takes a number of times equal to your half your Charisma modifier (rounded up_. You can't reduce a single instance of damage that a creature takes multiple times this way. You regain all uses of this feature at the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Practice
entries: Moon Guardians who revere dark magic, or even strive to cause suffering in others, make up members of the Shadow Practice. Dark and elusive, these Moon Guardians use misdirection and guile to gain the upper hand in battle.

entries.name: Draconic Darkness
entries: At 3rd level, your The Call of the Moon and that of your companion shifts to reflect the influence of darkness you now wield. Your dragon's relevant damage type becomes necrotic, and any damage and condition immunities it has are replaced with immunity to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Shadow Cloak
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can surround yourself in a shroud of darkness. As a bonus action on your turn, a 5 foot diameter sphere, centered on you or your dragon, becomes heavily obscured to creatures other than yourself and your dragon. The sphere of shadow lasts until the start of your next turn, and doesnâ€™t move with you.

You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). You regain all expended uses of this ability when you finish a short or long rest. When you hit 9th level in this class, the diameter of the sphere you summon can be 5 or 10 feet (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Withering Aura
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within 60 feet of you or your dragon, you can cause that creature to immediately die. Afterwards, a {@creature shadow|MM} rises from its corpse with the following changes:

items: The shadow's Intelligence and Charisma scores are reduced to 1.
If the shadow would reduce a creature's Strength score to 0, a new shadow is not created.
A shadow can only drop a creature to a minimum of 1 Strength, and cannot kill a creature by dropping them to 0.

entries: The shadows last until the end of your next turn, and they act alongside your initiative count. They take orders from both you and the dragon, requiring no action from either of you. You can only control a number of shadows equal to your Charisma modifier, and cannot have more than that many shadows summoned at once.

subclassFeature.name: Night Walker
entries: At 10th level, your body has begun to meld with the melody of the Shadowfell. You and your dragon have gained the ability to shift along the moving tides of shadow, rectifying your bodies into an absolute union between the Material and the Fell.
You and your dragon gain the ability to take the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. If you are in dim light or in darkness, you gain advantage on the ability check.

In addition, while in dim light or in darkness, you and your dragon can attempt to Hide even if you fail to meet the requirements needed to do so. At the end of the current turn, you remain hidden only if you then meet the normal requirements for hiding.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Shadows
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can manipulate darkness to slip away from your foes. When you use your Shadow Cloak feature, you can choose to also become invisible and teleport up to 30 feet to an empty space you can see within range. You remain invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force a creature to make a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Umbra Pulse
entries: At 18th level, you can create a vortex of swirling darkness around yourself as an action on your turn. Any number of creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw, with the DC being equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failed save, creatures take {@dice 10d10} necrotic damage and you can choose to have them either pulled up to 15 feet towards you or pushed up to 15 feet directly away from you. On a successful saving throw, creatures take half as much damage and aren't moved.
Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Practice
entries: Moon Guardians who consort with fey or are connected to the Feywild walk the path of the Fey Practice. Mysterious, tricky and capricious, these Moon Guardians wield illusory power to deceive and destroy their enemies in pursuit of their inscrutable goals.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Touched
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, your dragons fey magic seeps across your bond, infusing you with magical energy, you no longer need to sleep, and can instead fill long rests with light activity. You gain proficiency in either Arcana or Nature skills. Finally you know either the minor illusion or druidcraft cantrip, Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Shimmering Splendor
entries: When you choose this practice at 3rd level, your dragon is infused with the mystic energies of the feywild, giving it great innate magical power. As an action, your dragon can tap into its magics to create a shimmering illusionary clone of itself within 30 feet of itself. A clone has all of the same statistics as your dragon, but its hit point maximum is equal to your Moon Guardian level, it has an AC of 10 + your Charisma modifier, and cannot take actions.

An illusion acts on your dragon's turn and cannot move more than 100 feet away from it. An illusion lasts for 1 minute or until slain. Your dragon can have a maximum of two illusions active at once. When your dragon makes an attack, it can attack as if it were in the illusion's space.

When your dragon gains a Moon Rush, its range is reduced. A Moon Rush in the shape of a line becomes a 5 foot by 15 foot line, and a Moon Rush in the shape of a cone becomes a 10-foot cone. When your dragon uses its Moon Rush, each illusion also uses its Moon Rush. If a creature is subjected to more than one Moon Rush at once, it is only affected by one.
Finally, your dragon size becomes small and cannot be increased. The maximum number of illusions your dragon can have active at once increases by 1 at level 5 and again at level 9.

subclassFeature.name: Disruptive Breath
entries: Starting at 7th level your dragons connection to fey magics strengthens. As an action, your dragon exhales a cloud of magically infused gas which confuses and charms. The range and area of this Moon Rush is the same as your dragon's Moon Rush. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d8 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn:

entries.caption: 1d8 Behaviour
rows: The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.
The creature can act and move normally.

entries: An affected creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once your dragon has used this special Moon Rush it cannot do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shifting Reality
entries: At 10th level your dragons illusions shift and flicker with energy, when your dragon is hit with an attack, it can use its reaction to swap places with an illusion within 30 feet of it causing the illusion to take damage in its stead. It can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining any expended uses when it completes a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Residual Magics
entries: Starting at 15th level, your illusions becoming pseudo-tangible, gaining resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. When a creature fails a saving throw, against your Moon Rush or your Disruptive Breath feature, it becomes covered in soft glowing embers. The next attack roll against the creature has advantage, and it can't benefit from being invisible until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Present Splendor
entries: At 18th level, when your dragon makes a bite attack, all of your dragons illusions can make a single claw attack. While you are within 10 feet of your dragon, you are cloaked in dazzling fey energy, causing you to appear unearthly. You have advantage on Charisma checks and saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Garden Practice
entries: Some dragons wage war, and others hoard treasure. Few, however, learn to cultivate and nurture the earth, becoming one with it. Moon Guardians of the Garden Practice live simple lives with their dragons, and only heed the call of adventure if something precious to them is at stake.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Flora
entries: At 3rd level, the The Call of the Moon of your companion shifts to better reflect nature. Your dragon gains proficiency in the Nature skill, and your dragon also no longer needs to eat or drink. Instead, it gains sustenance for staying on the ground for at least 4 hours a day. Finally, you and your dragon can cast {@spell druidcraft}.
Your dragon also physically shifts to reflect this change, and its scales change colour to look like vibrant leaves, with flowers that bloom throughout.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Magic
entries: Also at 3rd level, your dragon's plant like nature allows it to attune to the seasons, granting the two of you benefits through the bond you share. When you finish a long rest, you choose one of the following seasons: Summer, Autumn, Winter, or Spring. Each season grants you benefits detailed in later features.

You gain access to the seasonal spells appropriate to the season you're attuned to. You can cast one of the seasonal spells you have access to once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You gain a second use of this feature at 5th level, a third use at 11th level. Casting a spell 3rd or 4th level seasonal spell expends two uses of this feature.
When you reach certain Moon Guardian levels, you gain new seasonal spells, as shown in each of the spell tables.

Finally, you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a seasonal spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Garden's Shield
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you cast one of your seasonal spells using your Seasonal Magic feature, you or your dragon (your choice) gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Charisma modifier, which last for 1 hour.
The number of dice you roll increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 7th level ({@dice 2d4}), 13th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 19th level ({@dice 4d4}).

subclassFeature.name: Season's Greetings
entries: At 7th level, your dragon's Moon Rush gains an additional benefit, depending on the season you're currently attuned to.

entries.name: Summer.
entries: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's Moon Rush have disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check they make before the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Autumn.
entries: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's Moon Rush are pushed 15 feet directly away from your dragon.

entries.name: Winter.
entries: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's Moon Rush have their movement speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Spring.
entries: Creatures that fail their saving throw against your dragon's Moon Rush are charmed by your dragon until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Between the Seasons
entries: At 10th level, you can manipulate your magic to reach out into other seasons. As an action, you can cast any 1st level spell with a casting time of 1 action you would acquire from your Seasonal Magic without expending a use of the feature. The spell you cast doesn't need to be from the season you're currently attuned too.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Garden's Grace
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you expend both uses of your Seasonal Magic to cast a 3rd or 4th level seasonal spell, you and your dragon both gain temporary hit points equal to the amount rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Seasonal Magic
entries: At 18th level, when you cast a spell using your Seasonal Magic, your dragon use its reaction to make a claw attack.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Practice
entries: Those of the Valiant Practice strive to lead their allies in battle. By weilding a magical banner to inspire valor and hope in their allies, these Moon Guardians are able to control and command the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Banner
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you can imbue a glaive, halberd, pike, spear or trident with your magic. During the course of a short or long rest, you can spend 1 hour to create this special weapon. You can only have one special weapon made this way at a time; if you create a new special weapon, the previous weapon loses its magic.
The weapon's damage type is the same as the dragon's relevant damage type (e.g. a Moon Guardian with a red dragon will have a weapon that deals fire damage), rather than its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Symbol of Inspiration
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can use your banner to inspire your allies to greater feats of strength. As an action, you can wave your banner until the start of your next turn. When you do so, an allied creature can use a bonus action while within 10 feet of you to gain one of the following effects, which you choose when you wave your banner.

entries.name: Banner of Might.
entries: While in this bannerâ€™s range, an ally can activate the effect of the banner to add 1d4 damage to any weapon attacks they make until the start of their next turn. The additional damage's type is the same as your dragon's relevant damage type.

entries.name: Banner of Resilience.
entries: While in this bannerâ€™s range, an ally can activate the effect of the banner to increase its AC by 1 until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Banner of Agility.
entries: While in this bannerâ€™s range, an ally can activate the effect of the banner to double its movement speed until the end of its turn.

Alternatively, you can choose to plant the banner in the ground after choosing an effect, placing it in an empty space within 5 feet of you. When you do so, an you and your allies can interact with your banner in the same way as though you were waving it using a bonus action. The banner remains for 1 minute, and can't be reclaimed or used as a weapon during this time. After you plant your banner, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Standard
entries: Beginning at 7th level, whenever you use your action to wave your valiant banner, if your Moon Wisdom can see you, it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.
In addition, the bannerâ€™s range while planted increases to 30 feet. Its range is also increased to 30 feet if you wave it while you are within 5 feet of your dragon.
Additionally, you can now plant your banner twice per short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Strike
entries: At 10th level, whenever a creature would make an attack against you while you are waving the banner, you can make an attack against that creature as a reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Courage
entries: Starting At 15th level, your banner becomes much more powerful. Whenever you wave your banner, all of the effects become available to choose from, rather than just one. Whenever you use a bonus action to gain a benefit from the banner, you can choose a second benefit.

Additionally, if you would be reduced to 0 hit points while you are waving your banner, you can choose to be reduced to 1 hit point instead. When you do so, your banner loses the ability to grant one of the benefits it offers until you finish a long rest. You choose the benefit that is lost.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Valiant Bindings
entries: At 18th level, your banner not only inspire allies, but also create barriers to trap foes. When you place a banner, you can create two additional banners, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first banner.

When these banners land, you can create a transparent wall of shimmering energy appear between any number of the banners. The wall is 10 feet high and 1 inch thick, and is immune to all damage, but can be dispelled by a 6th level dispel magic or a spell that nullifies magic of a similar or higher level. Spells that dispel walls in this way only dispel walls in the area they target, and any section outside of wall outside their range is not dispelled.

The walls cannot be moved through by creatures, other than ones you designate when you create the walls. When the wall appears, all creatures in its space are pushed to a side of the wall of your choice.
Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
